title: Two jailed Belerusian and Georgian journalists win EU's Sakharov human rights prize
subhead: The EU parliament awarded the Sakharov Prize, which recognizes struggles for human rights or democracy, to jailed Georgian journalist Mzia Amaghlobeli and Polish-Belarusian journalist Andrzej Poczobut.

title: More French voters leaning to the far right, poll shows
subhead: Marine Le Pen's far-right Rassemblement National party is well ahead in voter preferences, according to the 13th annual 'French Fractures' survey by Ipsos for Le Monde, the Jean Jaurès Foundation, CEVIPOF and the Montaigne Institute.

title: A new Israeli-Palestinian restaurant promotes peace through food in Paris
subhead: Edgar Laloum and Radjaa Aboudagga have just opened Sababa in Paris, offering bicultural culinary specialties. The two partners hope that, through the joys of culinary arts, they can help foster understanding and peace between communities.

title: 'Marching twice a year is not enough to catch up with Trump'
subhead: Seven million people demonstrated in the United States on October 18 to protest the Republican president's abuses. Yet these protests have offered little in the way of strategy, observes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.
